text: after searching Google, I've come to realize that we can't change or even append text to the title tag for the blog. Is this correct? if so, how are others dealing with this. we'd like to simply have a different title tag from an H1 tag for each post. I did find a hacky way of doing this (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Blog-template-Having-a-different-h1-and-page-title/td-p/18106>). but even simpler, we'd like to append `| Guru` to the end of each title tag. just hoping I missed some documentation somehow.

<@UM1PPQS2V> use JS to do this. You can use Javascript to manipulate the Meta Titles/Desc and Google will see that. <https://www.searchenginejournal.com/google-publishes-a-new-guide-to-javascript-seo-basics/317381/>
wow, did not see this one coming. thank you <@U2H3TT8F2>!
<@U2H3TT8F2>, i have thinking about this a lot lately. Do other crawlers do the same thing google does?
